title: Ticket #2127: Gridmanager crash caused by bad CreamResource hashtable managment
description:
In the gridmanager, the CreamResource class keeps a hashtable of all CreamResource objects. When an object is deleted, it's removed from the hashtable. But the key was constructed incorrectly when doing the removal. Then, a later lookup returns a bad pointer, whose use will corrupt memory.

This will happen when some jobs are submitted for a resource, they all complete and leave the queue, then another set of jobs are submitted destined for the same resource.

This problem was reported by Rod Walker. He was seeing a crash every 1-2 hours on some of his machines.
